snippet: The case would have required the Supreme Court to address a question it left open in a 2008 decision that found an individual right to keep guns for self-defense in the home.
abstract: Supreme Court refuses to hear gun-rights case involving New Jersey law that requires people seeking licenses to carry guns in public for self-defense to demonstrate a 'justifiable need.'
lead_paragraph: The case would have required the Supreme Court to address a question it left open in a 2008 decision that found an individual right to keep guns for self-defense in the home.

headline.main: Justices Turn Away Case About Carrying Guns in Public
headline.print_headline: Justices Let Law Restrict Taking Guns Into Public
